# Visualizing Variables & Relationships

## Summaries of One Variable: Continuous{.smaller}

Histogram for binner bars

```{r,fig.height=2.5, message=FALSE}
iris %>% ggplot(aes(x = Sepal.Length)) +
  geom_histogram()
```

**Reference system:**

* x = Variable value
* y = Observation count
* Symbol = Bar

## Summaries of One Variable: Continuous {.smaller}

Alternative: Probability density function (PDF) 

```{r,fig.height=2.5, message=FALSE}
iris %>% ggplot(aes(x = Sepal.Length)) +
  geom_density()
```

**Reference system:**

* x = Variable value
* y = Observation count
* Symbol = Line

## Summaries of One Variable: Discrete{.smaller}

Barplot

```{r,fig.height=2.5, message=FALSE}
iris  %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = Species)) +
  geom_bar()
```
**Reference system:**

* x = Variable category
* y = Observation count
* Symbol = Bar


## Summaries of One Variable: Discrete{.smaller}

Barplot (stacked)

```{r,fig.height=2.5, message=FALSE}
iris  %>%
  count(Species) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x="", y=n, fill=Species)) +
  geom_bar(width = 1, stat = "identity") +
  labs(x = NULL, y = NULL)

```
**Reference system:**

* y = Observation count
* Symbol = Bar
* Variable = Color

## Summaries of One Variable: Discrete{.smaller}

Pie Chart

```{r,fig.height=2.5, message=FALSE}
iris  %>%
  count(Species) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x="", y=n, fill=Species)) +
  geom_bar(width = 1, stat = "identity") + 
  coord_polar("y", start=0) +
  labs(x = NULL, y = NULL)

```
**Reference system:**

* y = Observation count
* Symbol = Bar (polar coordinates)
* Variable = Color

## Summarizing multiple variables jointly

Scatterplot (2 variables)

```{r,fig.height=2.5, message=FALSE}
iris  %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=Sepal.Width, y=Sepal.Length)) +
  geom_point()
```
**Reference system:**

* y = Value Variable y
* x = Value variable x
* Symbol = Point

## Summarizing multiple variables jointly

Scatterplot (3 variables, 2c1d)

```{r,fig.height=2.5, message=FALSE}
iris  %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=Sepal.Width, y=Sepal.Length, col=Species)) +
  geom_point()
```
**Reference system:**

* y = Value Variable y
* x = Value variable x
* Symbol = Point
* Variable: Color (Species)

## Summarizing multiple variables jointly

Scatterplot (3 variables, 3c)

```{r,fig.height=2.5, message=FALSE}
iris  %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=Sepal.Width, y=Sepal.Length, col=Petal.Length)) +
  geom_point()
```
**Reference system:**

* y = Value Variable y
* x = Value variable x
* Symbol = Point
* Variable: Color (Petal.Lenght)

## Summarizing multiple variables jointly

Scatterplot (4 variables, 3c,1d)

```{r,fig.height=2.5, message=FALSE}
iris  %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=Sepal.Width, y=Sepal.Length, col=Petal.Length, shape=Species)) +
  geom_point()
```
**Reference system:**

* y = Value Variable y
* x = Value variable x
* Symbol = Point
* Variable: Color (Petal.Lenght), Shape (Species)

## Statistical properties

Boxplot (Univariate distribution of multiple variables)

```{r,fig.height=2.5, message=FALSE}
iris  %>%
  select(-Species) %>%
  pivot_longer(everything(), names_to = 'variable') %>%
  ggplot(aes(x=variable, y=value)) +
    geom_boxplot()
```
**Reference system:**

* y = Value Variable 
* x = Value variable x
* Symbol = Confidence Interval Box


## Statistical properties

Correlation Matrix (bivariate distribution of multiple variables)

```{r,fig.height=2.5, message=FALSE}
library(GGally)
iris  %>%
  select(-Species) %>%
  ggcorr(label = TRUE, label_size = 3, label_round = 2, label_alpha = TRUE)
```
**Reference system:**

* y = Variable
* x = Variable
* VAriable: Color (Correlation)


## Statistical properties

Correlation Matrix (bivariate distribution of multiple variables)

```{r,fig.height=2.5, message=FALSE}
library(GGally)
iris  %>%
  ggpairs(aes(alpha = 0.3), ggtheme = theme_gray()) 
```
**Reference system:**

* y = Value Variable 
* x = Value variable x
* Symbol = Confidence Intervall Box
